posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Today, I was testing the PID for our robot, and at first it worked, moving to the exact position and stopping. Then, I tried to change our Constants.arm.Shoulder.gearRatio value and suddenly the arm didn’t move at all when I started the PID. I know that the PID is running because I had it print out something while the PID ran. Also, I outputted the encoder value of the motor as the PID ran and strangely, the encoder value was changing even though the motor wasn’t moving. Here’s our github: 3984-2023/testing-Imported at NEW-Pid-test · DesteoyerRZSS/3984-2023 (github.com)

posts.name: Waz
posts.cooked: The shoulder gear ratio in your constants file is currently set to 0. In your arm subsystem you use that constant as a divisor in several places. Since the ratio is defined to be a double, the result of these divisions should be infinity (the positive infinity sentinel value in Java since your dividends are positive). You then pass this result to a spark max conversion factor function. I have no idea what those functions will do with infinity but I am sure it is not what you would want.

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: The weird thing is when I change the value to something other than 0 it breaks the code completely and I have to re write the code. It only works if zero is there for some reason

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Can you elaborate on the feed forward part, what do you think would be the correct implementation of the feedforward?
Your feedforward calculation uses the velocity of 0, I am not sure that is correct.
